newsitem.title: UK: Med oil products firm, mainly on futures.
newsitem.headline: Med oil products firm, mainly on futures.

text.p: Mediterranean oil products were firmer on Thursday.
Gasoline was notionally firmer with futures although the region was seen relatively long.
Two mixed superplus/Eurograde cargoes were thought available out of Italy, one containing low benzene Eurograde material.
Naphtha was relatively tight. Various players were seen seeking N+A product but little activity was heard about.
Gas oil was firmer. There was a fair amount talk over low sulphur ahead the introduction 0.05 percent sulphur on regulations on October 1 approaches.
Premiums were put at anything between +$8 to $12 over 0.2 percent prices. While most Med-based refiners remain confident they can meet requirements traders outside of the region were sceptical
On the Russian material front, traders said there was talk of premiums of quotes cif high +$1.50/+$2.50, basis Genoa.

Good quality fuel oil of bunker spec remains tight with shortages in Italy and Spain. There was only a small parcel out of Augusta on the supply side and the two ISAB cargoes available in second half September will not be of sufficient quality.

A trader was understood to have split a 50,000 tonne high sulphur cracked cargo with 10-15,000 tonnes heading into Gibralter and around 35,000 tonnes sold into Tunisia. An unconfirmed price was cif high cif Med +$2/3. An ISAB cargo was also sold at high fob Med +$1 for end September loading.
Very little Russian straight run was being offered.
